data.comment: This interface provides access to LEDs. The interface controls an intensity value between 0.0 (off) and 1.0 (on, max intensity). LEDs that do not support intensity setting can only be set to on and off.
data.field: True if the switch is currently enabled.
If switches support multiple states these can be indicated with this value. For example for a switch that notes the intensity it could be a value in the valid range.

This value records the number of seconds a switch has been enabled continuously -- or not. The time is recorded in seconds. A positive value indicates time the switch was turned on, a negative value indicates the time (when converted to the absolute value) the button has not been pressed. Zero means "just initialized".
Number of consecutive short clicks (turned on). Can be used to recognize patterns of clicks. This is an optional field.
Number of consecutive short clicks (turned on). Can be used to recognize patterns of clicks. This is an optional field.
Number that is to be incremented whenever a short or long activation happened. Can be used to decide if a change in status happened.

message.name: Set
message.comment: For switches that support setting via software this message allows for setting the current state.

message.name: EnableSwitch
message.comment: For switches that support setting via software this message turns the switch on.

message.name: DisableSwitch
message.comment: For switches that support setting via software this message turns the switch off.

message.name: EnableDuration
message.comment: Enable switch for a specified duration only. The value can optionally be set. Note that not all SwitchInterface writers must or can support this.
message.field: Duration in seconds for which the switch should be enabled.
